aka: Valentine, St. Valentine, Valentines X, Saint Valentine

articles.author: Will Hyde
articles.text:
With Valentine’s Day right around the corner, I was looking for a strain to fall in love with, but even after digging through all the local dispensary menus on the Leafly Finder, I still lacked inspiration. So, naturally I typed 'Valentine' into the Leafly Explorer and the first result was Valentine X. Having little knowledge of the strain and never experiencing it for myself, I contacted the breeder, Synergy Wellness, a California-based medical cannabis dispensary specializing in CBD strains and products.
Valentine X is a balanced hybrid, equal parts indica and sativa, bred for its medicinal properties. Synergy explained that Valentine X has the highest ratio of CBD:THC at 25:1. Valentine X is a select phenotype of ACDC that is closely related but selectively bred to enhance the CBD profile even further. Synergy even went as far as testing the terpene characteristics and found that, while extremely similar, these two strains show minor variations in terpene concentrations.

Valentine X is named for St. Valentine, whose patronage, as you may know, includes love, engaged couples, and happy marriages. What you may not know is that St. Valentine is also the patron saint of epilepsy, and with all of the appreciation for CBD’s ability to limit seizures, especially in adolescents, this strain was dubbed Valentine X to reflect it medicinal properties.
Synergy describes Valentine X as a very mellow and smooth strain that produces an immediate sense of calm. The Leafly community finds Valentine X to be relaxing, euphoric, and happy, while sparking creativity and sociability.

The earthy flavors of Valentine X are attributed to the amplified levels of myrcene, caryophyllene, and pinene found in its terpene profile. Myrcene has an invigorating aroma and is found in other plants like eucalyptus and lemongrass. It's also known to treat spasms, pain, and curb insomnia. Caryophyllene adds spice to mix, like that found in cloves and black pepper, and offers antiseptic, anti-tumor, and antibacterial properties. Pinene gives off sharp pine flavors and spark alertness and suppress asthma.

Unfortunately, Valentine X isn’t available in the Seattle market right now so I have yet to try it. Have you? If so, leave a review on the strain’s detail page and use #MyLeaf to share your experience on social media.
Whether you’re single or taken, find some cannabis you love this weekend and have a Happy Valentine’s Day!
articles.title: Strain Highlight: Valentine X, the Patron Strain of Epilepsy

description: Named for St. Valentine, the patron saint of epilepsy, Valentine X is a 50/50 hybrid sought after for its exceptional healing powers and a CBD:THC ratio of 25:1. It is a variant of the remarkable ACDC that is cherished for its healing properties. Many find Valentine X to be a great help for seizure disorders, inflammation, and when treating cancer. In addition to its medicinal effects this strain is known to spark creative thinking.
descriptionPlain: Named for St. Valentine, the patron saint of epilepsy, Valentine X is a 50/50 hybrid sought after for its exceptional healing powers and a CBD:THC ratio of 25:1. It is a variant of the remarkable ACDC that is cherished for its healing properties. Many find Valentine X to be a great help for seizure disorders, inflammation, and when treating cancer. In addition to its medicinal effects this strain is known to spark creative thinking.

highlightedReviews.text:
Having heard this was akin to ACDC with a CBD to THC ratio of 25:1, I desperately wanted to find this.   A dispensary nearby finally started carrying it so I bought some.   I was so excited that I had found something like ACDC since I have a very low tolerance for THC and a negative reaction to even a moderate amount of it.  I was assured by the budmaster at the dispensary that this wouldn't get me high since it had so little THC and so much CBD.  
  
Boy, was THAT a LIE!   4 straight hours of paranoia,  muscle cramping, Sahara mouth (way beyond just "dry") and being VERY high.   I was absolutely miserable.  I use MMJ to combat chronic extreme pain.  The LAST thing I needed was my muscles tensing up and cramping up for 4 straight hours.   
  
I'm writing this as a WARNING to others.   Be careful.  Either I got bud from a freak high THC Valentine X plant or Valentine X isn't the 25:1 - CBD:THC ratio it's advertised as being.  
  
If you don't like the psychological effects of Marijuana,  do not use this strain.   Stick to ACDC or Harle-tsu.  They'll give you the pain relief you're looking for without the additional "high".

Fucking love this strain! Was very curious to try it because of its CBD dominant 25:1 and found it very surprising. I didn’t think you will get “smacked” off of it, but you can. It’s a definite body high with a head buzz. Very tingly, and talkative feeling.

name: Valentine X
